pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr3: Summarizes the rules and their origins in verse form. Begins with a set of verses on the Dhamma.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr4: A complex set of permutations in applying rules for monks and nuns.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr5: Details the circumstances for applying each of the four classes of procedure.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr6: Questions on the contents of each chapter of the Khandhakas.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr7: Vinaya topics arranged by number from one to eleven, in a manner similar to the Aṅguttara Nikāya.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr8: Defines the beginning, middle, and end of Sangha procedures.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr9: Explains the ten reasons for the laying down of Vinaya rules.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr10: Questions and answers on Vinaya topics in the form of an exchange of verses.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr11: Analyses the seven kinds of Vinaya procedure.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr12: A set of verses on the topic of admonishment.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr13: An analysis of the circumstances considered when admonishing someone.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr14: The character of one who is following the Vinaya.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr15: Requirements when a monastic is speaking on a matter of conflict before the Sangha.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr16: Summary of the procedures pertaining to the Kathina.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr17: Sets of five qualities presented as a conversation between the Buddha and Venerable Upāli.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr18: Different mind states and origins for various rules.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr19: Questions and answers in verse form.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr20: A set of Vinaya puzzles regarded as so difficult they make you sweat.
pli-tv-pvr-blurbs:pli-tv-pvr21: Vinaya topics divided into the validity of formal acts; the reasons for Vinaya; the kinds of procedure entailed; reasons for the procedures; and a nine-fold system of classification.
